propertiesClass.name: pureInboxMarkdown1
propertiesClass.defaultValue:
`
    ### pure Inbox screen consists of two screeen 
    - Default: This screen shows the  app with tasks. 
    - Error: This screen is for showing an error if the server failed to load.

    
  `

propertiesClass.name: pureInboxMermaid1
propertiesClass.defaultValue:
` ## PureInbox screen gonna have 2 stories. 
	
  flowchart TD	
  id1([ InboxScreen ])--> id2([ Default story  ])	
  id1-->id3([Error story])
`

propertiesClass.name: simpleTaskMarkdown1
propertiesClass.defaultValue:
`	
  	
- The Taskbox app is gonna consists of a   checkbox/Square box that can be activated or deactivated when ticked 	
- you can add the task title .	
- by using the pin icon on the right side of the corner you can set a task to be pinned on the top.	
 	
  ### The taskbox app will have 3 states which we are going to make through 3 different stories.	
  `

propertiesClass.name: simpleTaskMarkdown2
simpleTaskMermaid
propertiesClass.defaultValue:
` 
	
  flowchart TD	
  id1([Create a task.component.ts ])-->id2([Create a task.stories.ts])	
  id2-->id3([Make 3 Stories ])	
  id3-->id4[[1.Default]]	
  id3-->id5[[2.Pinned]]	
  id3-->id6[[3.Archived]]
`

propertiesClass.name: taskListMarkdown1
propertiesClass.defaultValue:
`	
    #####  As you can see  now we added two more states using storybook.	
    - Loading: In this story, we created a state where the task list is going to be loading to show 	
    - Empty: In this story, we don't have any tasks left to finish. 	
  `

propertiesClass.name: taskListMermaid
propertiesClass.defaultValue:
` 
	
    flowchart TD	
    id1([Create a tasklist.Component.ts file ])--> id2([Create a  tasklist.Stories.ts file])	
    id2-->id3([Create 4 Stories])	
    id3-->id4[[1.Default]]	
    id3-->id5[[2.Pinned ]]	
    id3-->id6[[3.Empty]]	
    id3-->id7[[4.Loading]]	
    id3-->id8([create an Empty array named task])	
    id8-->id9([Create a boolean varriable loading and set it false. ])	
    id9-->id10([change the  task array values to see different stories ])
`

propertiesClass.name: tems
propertiesClass.defaultValue: this.simpleTask

propertiesClass.name: mermaidcustomcolors
propertiesClass.defaultValue:
` 

  graph TD
  %% Nodes
      0[Key Variable]
      1[Top Variable 1]
      2[Top Variable 2]
      3[Top Variable 3]
      31[Sub Variable 1]
      32[Sub Variable 2]
      321[Element 1]
      322[Element 2]

  %% Links
      0 --- 1
      0 --- 2
      0 --- 3
      3 --- 31
      3 --- 32
      32 --- 321
      32 --- 322

          %% Defining the styles
      classDef Red fill:#FF9999;
      classDef Amber fill:#FFDEAD;
      classDef Green fill:#BDFFA4;

  %% Assigning styles to nodes
      class 3,32,321 Red;
      class 322 Amber;
      class 1,2,31 Green;
`

components.sourceCode:
import { Component, Input, AfterContentInit, ViewChild, TemplateRef, } from '@angular/core'; @Component({ selector: 'app-mermaidcode', templateUrl: './mermaid.component.html', }) export class MermaidComponent implements AfterContentInit { @ViewChild('fromTemplate', { static: true }) fromTemplate!: TemplateRef; @ViewChild('fromComponent', { static: true }) fromComponent!: TemplateRef; @ViewChild('fromSrc', { static: true }) fromSrc!: TemplateRef; @ViewChild('subgraph', { static: true }) subgraph!: TemplateRef; @ViewChild('attachclass', { static: true }) attachclass!: TemplateRef; @ViewChild('simpleform', { static: true }) simpleform!: TemplateRef; @ViewChild('customcolors', { static: true }) customcolors!: TemplateRef; @ViewChild('fa', { static: true }) fa!: TemplateRef; @ViewChild('themes', { static: true }) themes!: TemplateRef; tems: TemplateRef = this.fromTemplate; myContext = { $implicit: 'World', localSk: 'Svet' }; @Input() myselectedtemp: string = 'fromComponent'; mermaidfromtemplate = ` ## keep a variable in component to load the value \`\`\`typescript 
    flowchart TD
    id1([Mermaid]) --> id2([Markdown in html])
    id1([Mermaid]) -->  id3([Markdown in template])
    id1([Mermaid]) --> id4([Markdown in data])
    id1([Mermaid]) --> id5([Markdown loaded from src])
\`\`\` `; mermaidfromcomponent = ` 
    flowchart TD
    id1([Mermaid]) --> id2([Markdown in html])
    id1([Mermaid]) -->  id3([Markdown in template])
    id1([Mermaid]) --> id4([Markdown in data])
    id1([Mermaid]) --> id5([Markdown loaded from src])
`; mermaidfromcomponentExplain = ` ## keep a variable in component to load the value \`\`\`typescript mermaidfromcomponent = \` 
    flowchart TD
    id1([Mermaid]) --> id2([Markdown in html])
    id1([Mermaid]) -->  id3([Markdown in template])
    id1([Mermaid]) --> id4([Markdown in data])
    id1([Mermaid]) --> id5([Markdown loaded from src])
\` \`\`\` ## And call the variable from Template \`\`\`typescript {{ mermaidfromcomponent}} \`\`\` `; mermaidfromSrcExplain = ` # Working for app.component.html but not working in strories ## Need to raise PR for storybook \`\`\`typescript
\`\`\` ## Testing.md file contains \`\`\`typescript 
  journey
    title My Career Graph
    section Before Tech
    Secondary- 88%: 1: Manoj
    Higher Secondary-89%: 2: Manoj
    College-UG- 67%: 3: Manoj
    College-PG- 74%: 4: Manoj
    section After Tech
    Lecturer- 1Y: 5: Manoj
    Telecom Testing- 14Y: 6: Manoj
    Development- 7Y: 7: Manoj
\`\`\` `; mermaidsubgraph = ` 
  flowchart TB
  c1-->a2
  subgraph one
  a1-->a2
  end
  subgraph two
  b1-->b2
  end
  subgraph three
  c1-->c2
  end
`; mermaidsubgraphExplained = ` ## Easiliy we can explain ideas in subgraphs \`\`\`typescript 
  flowchart TB
  c1-->a2
  subgraph one
  a1-->a2
  end
  subgraph two
  b1-->b2
  end
  subgraph three
  c1-->c2
  end
\`\`\` `; mermaidattachclass = ` 
  flowchart LR
    A:::someclass --> B
    classDef someclass fill:#f96;
`; mermaidattachclassExplained = ` ## Easiliy we can explain relationship between classes \`\`\`typescript 
  flowchart LR
    A:::someclass --> B
    classDef someclass fill:#f96;
\`\`\` `; mermaidsimpleform = ` 
    graph LR
    %% Nodes
    1([Start])
    2[Look for lost item]
    3{Did I find it?}
    4([Stop])
    %% Node links
    1 --> 2 --> 3 -->|Yes| 4
    3 -.->|No| 2
`; mermaidsimpleformExplained = ` ## Easiliy we can explain Simple Forms \`\`\`typescript 
    graph LR
    %% Nodes
    1([Start])
    2[Look for lost item]
    3{Did I find it?}
    4([Stop])
    %% Node links
    1 --> 2 --> 3 -->|Yes| 4
    3 -.->|No| 2
\`\`\` `; mermaidcustomcolors = ` 

  graph TD
  %% Nodes
      0[Key Variable]
      1[Top Variable 1]
      2[Top Variable 2]
      3[Top Variable 3]
      31[Sub Variable 1]
      32[Sub Variable 2]
      321[Element 1]
      322[Element 2]

  %% Links
      0 --- 1
      0 --- 2
      0 --- 3
      3 --- 31
      3 --- 32
      32 --- 321
      32 --- 322

          %% Defining the styles
      classDef Red fill:#FF9999;
      classDef Amber fill:#FFDEAD;
      classDef Green fill:#BDFFA4;

  %% Assigning styles to nodes
      class 3,32,321 Red;
      class 322 Amber;
      class 1,2,31 Green;
`; mermaidcustomcolorsExplained = ` ## Easiliy we can explain with custom colors \`\`\`typescript 

  graph TD
  %% Nodes
      0[Key Variable]
      1[Top Variable 1]
      2[Top Variable 2]
      3[Top Variable 3]
      31[Sub Variable 1]
      32[Sub Variable 2]
      321[Element 1]
      322[Element 2]

  %% Links
      0 --- 1
      0 --- 2
      0 --- 3
      3 --- 31
      3 --- 32
      32 --- 321
      32 --- 322

          %% Defining the styles
      classDef Red fill:#FF9999;
      classDef Amber fill:#FFDEAD;
      classDef Green fill:#BDFFA4;

  %% Assigning styles to nodes
      class 3,32,321 Red;
      class 322 Amber;
      class 1,2,31 Green;
\`\`\` `; mermaidfa = ` 
  flowchart TD
    B["fab:fa-twitter for peace"]
    B-->C[fa:fa-ban forbidden]
    B-->D(fa:fa-spinner);
    B-->E(A fa:fa-camera-retro perhaps?)
`; mermaidfaExplained = ` ## Font Awesome is not working - Mermaid is now only compatible with Font Awesome versions 4 and 5 \`\`\`typescript 
    flowchart TD
      B["fab:fa-twitter for peace"]
      B-->C[fa:fa-ban forbidden]
      B-->D(fa:fa-spinner);
      B-->E(A fa:fa-camera-retro perhaps?)
\`\`\` `; mermaidthemes = ` 
    %%{init: {'theme': 'base', 'themeVariables': { 'primaryColor': '#ff0000'}}}%%
            graph TD
              A[Christmas] -->|Get money| B(Go shopping)
              B --> C{Let me think}
              B --> G[/Another/]
              C ==>|One| D[Laptop]
              C -->|Two| E[iPhone]
              C -->|Three| F[fa:fa-car Car]
              subgraph section
                C
                D
                E
                F
                G
              end
`; mermaidthemesExplained = ` ## Themes is working \`\`\`typescript 
  
    %%{init: {'theme': 'base', 'themeVariables': { 'primaryColor': '#ff0000'}}}%%
            graph TD
              A[Christmas] -->|Get money| B(Go shopping)
              B --> C{Let me think}
              B --> G[/Another/]
              C ==>|One| D[Laptop]
              C -->|Two| E[iPhone]
              C -->|Three| F[fa:fa-car Car]
              subgraph section
                C
                D
                E
                F
                G
              end
\`\`\` `; ngAfterContentInit() { switch (this.myselectedtemp) { case 'fromTemplate': this.tems = this.fromTemplate; break; case 'fromComponent': this.tems = this.fromComponent; break; case 'fromSrc': this.tems = this.fromSrc; break; case 'subgraph': this.tems = this.subgraph; break; case 'attachclass': this.tems = this.attachclass; break; case 'simpleform': this.tems = this.simpleform; break; case 'customcolors': this.tems = this.customcolors; break; case 'fa': this.tems = this.fa; break; case 'themes': this.tems = this.themes; break; } } }

components.name: StorybookDesignComponent

propertiesClass.name: addmdxsteps
propertiesClass.defaultValue:
`
  
  # Refer to other stories and add them in the mdx file

  ## MDX file should have the same name as the component to replace the docs

  \`\`\`powershell
  import { Canvas, Meta, Story } from '@storybook/blocks';

import * as markdown from '../markdowncode/markdown.stories';
import * as mermaid from '../mermaidcode/mermaid.stories';
import * as task from './simpletask.stories';

<Meta of={task} />

# Checkbox

A checkbox is a square box that can be activated or deactivated when ticked. 

Use checkboxes to select one or more options from a list of choices.

## Usage

<Story of={mermaid.MermaidFromTemplate} />

# Checkbox

A checkbox is a square box that can be activated or deactivated when ticked. 

Use checkboxes to select one or more options from a list of choices.

## Usage

<Story of={markdown.MarkdownFromTemplate} />

\`\`\`
  `

propertiesClass.name: addstorysteps
chromaticsteps
propertiesClass.defaultValue:
`
  
  # Create Chromtic login and create a new project tocken
  \`\`\`powershell

  "chromatic": "npx chromatic --project-token=f38be8eee28a  --exit-once-uploaded"
  
  \`\`\`
  `

propertiesClass.name: gitsteps
propertiesClass.defaultValue:
`
  
  # Git commands to push to repo and gh-pages
  \`\`\`powershell
  git remote remove origin
  git remote add origin https://github.com/gmanojisaac/AngularStorybook.git
  git remote -v show
  git add .
  git commit -am “Completed storybook design”
  git push -u origin storydesign
  npm run pre-deploy
  npm run deploy-storybook

  \`\`\`
  `

propertiesClass.name: importsteps
propertiesClass.defaultValue:
`

  # Import Modules for story use
  ## Import sharedModule which contains FlexBox, HTTPClient Module for MarkdownModule
  ## Component is used in the StorybookdesignComponent

  \`\`\`powershell
  moduleMetadata({

    declarations: [StorybookDesignComponent],
    imports: [
      CommonModule,
      SharedModule,
      HttpClientModule,
      MarkdownModule.forRoot({ loader: HttpClient }),
    ]
  }),
  applicationConfig({
    providers: [
      importProvidersFrom(
        CommonModule,
        HttpClientModule,
        MarkdownModule.forRoot({ loader: HttpClient }),
        MarkdownService
      ),
    ],
  }),
  \`\`\`
  `
